arts.ttl: Coventry City 2-2 Sheffield United: 10-Men Blades Grind Out Hard-Earned Point
arts.sum: Coventry City pushed for a late winner against Sheffield United on Saturday, but in the end the ten men of the Blades managed to hang on to a point in a 2-2 draw. The visitors took an early lead in the 14th minute when Tyrese Campbell latched onto an excellent low cross from Jesurun Rak-Sakyi […] The post Coventry City 2-2 Sheffield United: 10-Men Blades Grind Out Hard-Earned Point appeared first on Sheff United Way.

arts.ttl: Chris Wilder makes 'mugged' accusation as he singles out Coventry City goal scorer
arts.sum: “We tried to hang on in there but we need to be more disciplined in light of a few incidents that went off, so I have no issue with the red card and the referee’s decision,” said Wilder in his post-match assessment of the 2-2 draw. Chris Wilder claimed his Sheffield United side were “mugged” by Coventry City’s Norman Bassette who clashed with Anel Ahmedhodzic, sparking a reaction from the defender who was then shown the red card for violent conduct.

arts.ttl: Championship roundup: Burnley beat Bristol City as Blades held to a draw
arts.sum: Managerless Coventry twice come from behind to draw Cardiff and Sheffield Wednesday share the points in a 1-1 Jaidon Anthony’s first-half strike proved enough for Burnley to take three points from a 1-0 victory over Bristol City in a rousing Championship battle at Ashton Gate. The winning goal came on 23 minutes when Anthony found the roof of the net with a close-range shot after Max O’Leary had dived full length to palm a Josh Brownhill shot into his path. Burnley were the better side for an hour, but had to withstand a fired-up finale from the home side, who came close to rescuing a point and claimed to be denied a clear penalty late on when a free-kick into the box skidded on to Brownhill’s arm. arts.ttl: Managerless Coventry hit back to hold 10-player Sheff Utd
arts.sum: Managerless Coventry twice came from a goal down to draw 2-2 with 10-man Sheffield United at the CBS Arena.

arts.ttl: Coventry twice hit back to hold high-flying Sheffield United
arts.sum: Bobby Thomas rescued a late point for his side.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings v Sheffield United as Sky Blues battle back twice against ten man Blades - Andy Turner
arts.sum: City came flying out of the blocks with some exciting and determined attacking play but that positive start came crashing down when they were hit by the Blades’ first attack, with Gus Hamer feeding Jesurun Rak-Sakyi who raced down the right and sent in a square ball to the six yard box where Tyrese Campbell slotted home to give the visitors the lead in the 13th minute. Hamer was the architect again, however, just after the half hour mark when he played Rak-Sakyi free in the box to the left of the goal, leaving the forward to drill home into the far bottom corner to restore United’s lead.

arts.ttl: Chris Wilder pays 'incredible' tribute to Mark Robins and claims Coventry City successor decision 'close'
arts.sum: Speaking in his pre-match press conference ahead of today’s lunchtime kick-off, Wilder said: “First of all I’d like to pay tribute to Mark Robins and the work that he did at that football club. “We all understand the journey he was on and where they were and the issues they had, financial issues, supporter issues and the tough journey that club has been on, to get them within a penalty kick of the Premier League and within an incredibly tight decision to an FA Cup final, the group he assembled.

arts.ttl: Chris Wilder Discusses Oliver Arblaster Injury, Tom Davies Return And Coventry City’s Threat
arts.sum: As the Championship season moves into a critical phase, Sheffield United will restart their campaign with a visit to the CBS Arena to face Coventry City on Saturday afternoon. Coventry City enter the fixture buoyed by their dramatic 2-2 comeback against Sunderland. Down 2-0 at halftime, caretaker manager Rhys Carr inspired a remarkable turnaround, securing […] The post Chris Wilder Discusses Oliver Arblaster Injury, Tom Davies Return And Coventry City’s Threat appeared first on Sheff United Way.

arts.ttl: Chris Wilder drops printed T-shirts quip as dynamic duo 'desperate' on first Coventry City return
arts.sum: Chris Wilder says Gustavo Hamer and Callum O’Hare are “desperate” to do well on their first playing returns to Coventry City – the club where they made their names in English football. Hamer, meanwhile, is sure to get a warm reception at the CBS Arena where supporters loved watching him play for three seasons before he was sold for £15m the summer before last, since when he's returned as a spectator on several occasions.
